Project.name: Pipes Utility Unit Tests for AS3
Project.Description: This is the Unit Tests Project for the Pipes utility, which provides the capability for creating pipelines that pass messages between Cores in a PureMVC AS3 MultiCore-based application. Pipelines can contain filters, queues, splitting and merging tees, and more.
Project.ReleaseNotes:
Features in 1.0
  • These Unit Tests exercise each method of every class in the utility, and ensure that everything works as expected.
  • The tests are arranged to run from simplest to most complex, so that assertions can be skipped on pieces that have been tested prior to any given test.
Project.Installation:
Installing the Project Source Code From the archive
  • Download the latest source code archive.
  • Unzip the source code zip to any folder on your disk.
  • For instance: c:\development\
  • You will see a Pipes_UnitTests_X_Y (where X_Y is version) source folder.
  • For instance: c:\development\Pipes_UnitTests_X_Y
From the Repository
  • Use your favorite SVN client to retrieve the latest source code release from the repository.
Setup and Compile the Demo Using Flex Builder 3
  • Create a new ActionScript Project called 'Pipes_UnitTests' in Flex Builder 3, pointing to the new Pipes_UnitTests_X_Y source folder.
  • Add the required libraries to the project's build path.
  • From the Flex Builder menu do: Project -> Properties -> Flex Build Path -> Library Path -> Add SWC Folder
  • Browse and select: Pipes_UnitTests/libs.
  • Run Pipes_UnitTests.mxml
